Articles.Content:
I know it has been asked million of times, but it got old and no one looked at it,

So simply say your fav planet/moon and also say why? what you like the most about it? what you would like to see added to it?.. those kind of questions

for me:

I like Duna the most,

Duna feels like kerbin, if not more, it's red.. polar caps.. it's just an amazing place to live on, with a big 'rock' floating in the sky, and it's sand blowing off at my helmet ( dat poem! ).

I'd like to see more stuff on duna, like a huge mountain ( which exists now, 7 km high I believe ), with a cave under it, some clouds here and there, also some wind making tornado's ( dust devil's ) , something more intresting under the ground to make 'science' out of it, like finding water..etc.

So yeah! your turn!

P.S: you can post 2 planets and two moons.

Edited October 6, 2013 by MrPopcup
Laythe! Why not? It's a great place to put a base.
I like Minimus, it reminds me of mint ice cream. Also it had cool terrain and low gravity perfect for exploration.
mÃƒÂ¼n because im addicted to jump around there derping =O
I like Lathe, which is a problem because Jool HATES me. Duna is a nice one too, but can be a bit tricky to land on. Though I have been aiming for mostly unpowered descents.

I like Duna alot because its red :3

I also love Eloo, even though Ive never been there. I love snow. Its next on my checklist to land on!
Duna - its the best place to pull off a really intricate mission without high risk of failure

I like Lathe, which is a problem because Jool HATES me. Duna is a nice one too, but can be a bit tricky to land on. Though I have been aiming for mostly unpowered descents.

How does Jool hate you? The Delta V required to get there?
Duna, because it's easy to build a reusable architecture for colonizing and exploring it. Ike is fun too.
I quite like Minmus, its just cool, and you can haul good loads of kethane up to orbit if you do it right.

How does Jool hate you? The Delta V required to get there?

EVERY mission sent runs out of fuel for some reason or another, ends up retrograde, crashes, or gets slingshotted out of the system into interplanetary space.

Lost at least 5 probes and a manned mission with Jeb, Bill, and Bob on board so far,

ends up retrograde

Can somebody clarify why ending up in retrograde orbit is so undesirable? My Duna mission went fine and I was in a retrograde orbit - is it something to do with the Oberth effect?
Personally, I think Jool is beautiful, as long as you don't get too close. Dat moon system.

Can somebody clarify why ending up in retrograde orbit is so undesirable? My Duna mission went fine and I was in a retrograde orbit - is it something to do with the Oberth effect?

Well, with Jool, you probably want to visit/land on the moons. These orbit in the prograde direction, which may prove inconvient if you're orbiting retrograde .

Most definedly Duna at this point. So many succcess stories with reasonable amount effort. Next thing I am planning large base there but first I need to flag every darn thing in solar system. =)) Is there good mod for base making? Just found this: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-18-1-h-o-m-e-start-kit/ but dunno if it's any good. Don't want mess up the game, NovaPunch is awesome though. Just right amount of kick but not making things too easy.

Edit: Laythe seems to be very interesting. Going to make mission there next.

Edited October 6, 2013 by TUFOM

Well, with Jool, you probably want to visit/land on the moons. These orbit in the prograde direction, which may prove inconvient if you're orbiting retrograde .

Ohh, okay that makes sense. Always confused me, that did

Gilly because that little guy has so little Gravity, you can land with NERVAS or RCS even!

Dres has my favourite canyon.

Dres FTW!

all on it's own it looks so peaceful.
Pol!! Gotta love those spiky ridges! Also, low gravity and eccentric orbit are fun.

Well, with Jool, you probably want to visit/land on the moons. These orbit in the prograde direction, which may prove inconvient if you're orbiting retrograde .

This. Try circularizing around Pol with an ion probe whilst going retrograde.
Duna, it is awesome because it has an atmosphere, ice caps, a moon and a solid surface, so it is close to Kerbin, so it is great for a base because it has many interesting Easter eggs
Laythe, just ahead of Duna. Then Jool. And Gilly
I love Ike because of its similarity to the Mun. Basically, I see it as a home away from home.

Mun, because reenacting Apollo missions in my Kerpollo ship makes me feel like a badass.

Minmus, because you can jump a million miles.

Jool, because everyone who goes near it gets physicsed.

EDIT: Yes, physicsed. The past-tense verb of when physics hates you and attacks you violently.

Pretty much all of the asteroid-moons (Gilly, Bop, Pol, and even Minmus) get my vote for favorite. Excessively low gravity combined with fantastic hills and valleys to explore; what's not to love? Of them all, Pol is my current favorite due to its terrain scatter adding those spire-like rock formations.
